intro: Scrophularia edelbergii subsp. edelbergii, commonly known as the Edelberg's scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or dry soils. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its opposite leaves and erect growth habit. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
